ext_descriptions.ext_description: The attribute_type data type allows for the designation of a label or a text that can be assigned to an attribute of an entity.

An action_assignment is an association of an
with product data.

the instance of the
entity data type that is to be associated with product data.

ext_description.p:
the
that specifies the purpose of the association of the action_assignment with product data.
ext_description.note: This attribute is an enhancement to the definition of action_assignment using a method that is upwardly compatible with ISO 10303-41:1994.

ext_description.p:
Each action_assignment shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note: A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An action_method_assignment is an association of an
with product data.

the instance of the
entity data type that is to be associated with the product data.

ext_description.p:
the
that specifies the purpose of the association of the action_method_assignment with product data.
ext_description.note: The values related to this attribute can be specified in an annotated EXPRESS schema that uses or specializes this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An action_method_role is a definition of a role for an
and a description of that role.
'Process XYZ' is an . An
assigns the
to the definition of a specific mechanical part. The action_method_role for the
is 'Process to mill mechanical part'.

the
that characterizes the action_method_role. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
the
by which the action_method_role is known.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
The entity data type implements the association of the role with a specific .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An attribute_classification_assignment is an association of a class to an attribute of an existing entity in order to characterize it further. The meaning of the class of the existing attribute is determined by the role.

the
that serves as a classification.
the attribute for which the classification is defined. The attribute_name shall identify an attribute of the assigned entity.

ext_description.p:
the
that specifies the purpose of the association of the attribute_classification_assignment with product data.
ext_description.note: The values related to this attribute can be specified in an annotated EXPRESS schema that uses or specializes this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An attribute_value_assignment extends the cardinality of a string valued attribute in an entity data type by one.
The relationship of the extension to the existing attribute is determined by the role. The entity data types that have the attribute for which the extension is provided are identified by a specialization of .

ext_description.p: the attribute for which the additional value is defined. The attribute_name shall identify an attribute of the assigned entity.
ext_description.note: The identified attribute may be defined in the entity or inherited from a supertype.
ext_description.example: 'name' and 'description' are examples for the attribute_name.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
that contains, as , the additional value for the attribute of the assigned entity specified by attribute_name.

ext_description.p:
the
that specifies the purpose of the association of the attribute_value_assignment with product data.
ext_description.note: The values related to this attribute can be specified in an annotated EXPRESS schema that uses or specializes this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The type of attribute_value (label or text) shall be the same as the type of the attribute specified by attribute_name.
An attribute_value_role is a description of the purpose of an additional value assigned to an attribute of an entity.

the
that characterizes the attribute_value_role. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
the
by which the attribute_value_role is known.
ext_description.example: 'Additional marketing name', 'primary value', or 'translated' are examples for name.

Multiple constraints can be expressed by multiple instances of (a subtype of) . Such multiple instances can refer to the same instance of
or to different instances.

An external_identification_assignment is a type of
that is defined in the context of an . The
shall be a valid identifier in the context of the source.

the
that specifies the context in which in the
is defined.

ext_description.p: An external_referent_assignment is an identification of product data referenced in outside sources.
ext_description.note: This is an incompletely modeled concept and requires population of related entity data types to form a complete external_referent_assignment.
ext_description.example: A URI for an externally defined tool is specified by assigning the value 'http://www.tool.com/mill.stp' to the name attribute of external_referent_assignment. The fact that the value is a URI is established by assigning a value of 'uri' to the role attribute of external_referent_assignment.

A URI fragment identifier for the bottom face of the externally defined tool is specified by assigning the value 'http://www.tool.com/mill.stp#bottom_face' to the name attribute of external_referent_assignment. The fact that the value is a URI

ext_description.p:
the
by which the external_referent_assignment is known.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the
that specifies the purpose of the association of the external_referent_assignment with product data.
ext_description.note: This attribute is an enhancement to the definition of external_referent_assignment using a method that is upwardly compatible with ISO 10303-41:1994.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An identification_assignment is an association of an identification with product data. The assignment is made within a specified role.

ext_description.p: the identification associated with the product data.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the
that specifies the purpose of the association of the identification_assignment with product data.
ext_description.example: 'Alias identification' is an example of a role that may be used to characterize the fact that the assigned_id provides an alternate identification to some product data.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An identification_assignment_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
and provides an identification and description of their relationship.
The role of identification_assignment_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

the
that characterizes the identification_assignment_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

the
by which the identification_assignment_relationship is known.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p: An reference_in is a pre-defined a way for an external reference into a set of entity instances.
ext_description.note: An HTML documents may contain "A" elements with a name attribute, or any other elements with an id attribute. The entity reference_in provides an equivalent capability for an exchange file according to ISO 10303-21.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
that distinguishes the reference_in.
the entity instance for which an reference_in is defined.
Within an exchange set all ids shall be unique.
For a target instance at most one reference_in shall be defined.

entity data type that is to be associated with product data.

that specifies the purpose of the association of the security_classification_assignment with product data.
ext_description.note: This attribute is an enhancement to the definition of security_classification_assignment using a method that is upwardly compatible with ISO 10303-41:1994

ext_description.p:
Each security_classification_assignment shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note: A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

with product data.

entity data type that is to be associated with product data.

ext_description.p:
the
that specifies the purpose of the association of the time_assignment with product data.
ext_description.example: 'Start time' is an example of a role that may be used to characterize the fact that the assigned_time defines the time when some action was expected to start.

The acyclic_identification_assignment_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either an
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
that the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified entity name of a type of
entity.
